author: WSJ Staff
title: WSJ Wealth Adviser Briefing: Blockchain, Rising Dollar, Fake Ferrari
text: The best-paid CEOs donâ€™t necessarily run the best-performing companies, writes Vanessa Fuhrmans. Corporate boards have tried for years to tie chief executive compensation to the results they deliver. The better the company and its shareholders do, the more the top boss should be paid, or so the pay-for-performance mantra goes.
